review: Without getting into too much slagging on this slick little box, there is definitely a to-do list for the devs:1.  Release date ETA sheet for forthcoming apps, especially high profile ones (e.g., MLB.TV);2.  Ability to return all results -- even if only is a submenu -- when using voice search;3.  Must be able to automatically start next video in Amazon app (Netflix app has this functionality) [applies to Plex as well];These are must haves -- without these items, three stars, with them, five stars; navigation is clunky, but fast; voice search is fantastic (but limited to Amazon only); playback is quick even in a limited wireless network range; ability to add apps is clear and intuitive; plug and play functionality -- and auto-assignment to Amazon Prime account -- are nice bonuses.This is a very good version 0.9 build; can't wait for 1.0.
author: Tomorrow's Man "Tomorrow's Man"

review: But it is slower the the Roku 3 and sometimes leaves the movie I am watching and the reloads it for no good reason at all.  It is not my router connection, either.  It has something to do with the Amazon Fire TV unit.  As I have a Roku 3, and it loads very fast and never stops to reload the streaming video I am watching.And the selection of apps you can have with this unit are very limited:  Amazon Instant Video, Netflix, Hulu, Vudu and Crackle which shows commercials (I hate commercials).  I can not even listen to the music that I purchased from Amazon, that is loaded on my Amazon MP3 Cloud Player, as that is not an option!I am really wondering and thinking about sending this unit back and the remote I bought with it and just getting another Roku 3 or another Smart TV, in the future.  I have had the unit for a week, now, and I am not impressed with it, at all.

review: I'll keep it short and concentrate on the reason I gave it the single star. There are many reviews that go in depth on the features that work.It has a USB port, the USB port is disabled. It wasn't until I downloaded the Amazon Fire TV User Guide PDF that I was told "The USB port currently does not support any accessories." I was hoping to use it as a classy video playback device for videos on a thumb drive.  There are many media players on the market that provide this basic feature, I had hoped to find similar functionality in the Amazon Fire TV but it has not been implemented. The Amazon Fire is useless without the internet, do not purchase this device if you wish to play videos connected to the unit itself, it will not.
